body_html:
@zou3519 Did we officially document which instruction sets our binaries support?

In any case, I believe that if you compile from source you can get PyTorch using the set of instructions your computer supports. For some newer instructions, we do compile multiple times with and without so we can distribute a single set of binaries, but we have to pick a cut off somewhere (or bloat our binary sizes by a lot more.)

body:
@zou3519 Did we officially document which instruction sets our binaries support?

In any case, I believe that if you compile from source you can get PyTorch using the set of instructions your computer supports. For some newer instructions, we do compile multiple times with and without so we can distribute a single set of binaries, but we have to pick a cut off somewhere (or bloat our binary sizes by a lot more.)
